poem:
**Gig Economy Dance**

Outside the council's grand façade—  
a scramble,  
tutors pecking crumbs  
of hours,  
glossed digital windows  
shut against  
the cold reality  
of unstrung weeks.  
Here, time's a feast  
feathered  
with fracture,  
each moment  
a hollow beak clattering  
for morsels  
dropped from  
implacable skies.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "British Council accused of forcing gig economy teachers into ‘feeding frenzy’ for work The British Council has been accused of exploiting hundreds of agency teachers on zero-hour contracts forced to compete for lessons in a “feeding frenzy” every week. An open letter from teaching staff reveals the prestigious government-funded public body does not offer regular hours to tutors on its popular English Online platform, which provides lessons to more than 45,000 students worldwide. Instead, up". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
